({{lang-ar|جميلة المطربات العرب}}) by 2016 [[Miss Arab World]] | spouse = {{marriage|?|1998|2009|end=divorced}} | children = 1 | family = | awards = {{flat list| *Honorary Award by [[Lebanese Armed Forces|LAF]] (2010-11-15-16) }} | website = | signature_size = | signature_alt = | footnotes = | module = {{Infobox musical artist|embed=yes | background = solo_singer | genre = {{flat list| *[[Arabic pop music|Arabic Pop]] *[[Music of Lebanon|Lebanese Folk]] *[[Dance music|Dance]] }} | label = Aya Production {{small|(2007–2010)}}
Layal Production {{small|(2010–current)}}
Lola's World {{small|(2017–current)}} | associated_acts = {{hlist|Adnan Ismail|[[Melhem Barakat]]|Hisham El Hajj|Sobhi Toufic|Amir Yazbek|Hussein Al Deek|}} | years_active = 2007–present }} }} '''Layal Mounir Abboud''' ({{lang-ar|ليال منير عبود}}, {{IPA-ar|laj'ja:l ʕab'bu:d|pron|Ar-F-Layal Abboud.ogg}}; born 15 May 1982) is a Lebanese [[pop singer]], [[folk music]] [[entertainer]], [[Sound poetry|sound]]-[[Lyric poetry|lyric poet]], [[concert dancer]], [[fit model]] and Muslim [[humanitarian]].{{cite web|title=Layal Abboud|url=http://www.insight-egypt.com/celebrities/layal-abboud/july-16/214|website=insight-egypt.com|publisher=Insight Publishing House Limited, UK.|accessdate=24 August 2017}}{{cite web|title=Layal Abboud: The unworthy recipient of a cultural award|url=https://now.mmedia.me/lb/en/blogs/566856-layal-abboud-the-unworthy-recipient-of-a-cultural-award|website=now.mmedia.me|publisher=The NOW team|accessdate=23 August 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170823165112/https://now.mmedia.me/lb/en/blogs/566856-layal-abboud-the-unworthy-recipient-of-a-cultural-award|archivedate=23 August 2017|df=}}{{cite web|title=ليال عبود – Layal Abboud|url=http://www.knopedia.com/2016/11/Layal-Abboud-CV.html|website=معلومات السيرة الذاتية، قصة حياة المشاهير|publisher=knopedia.com|accessdate=23 August 2017}} Born to a musical family in the [[South Governorate|Southern Lebanese]] [[Tyre District|Tyrian]] village of [[Kniseh, Tyre|Kniseh]], Abboud is a former [[Internal Security Forces|ISF]] [[police officer|officer]] and studied [[English literature]] at [[Lebanese University]], [[translation]] at [[Beirut Arab University]] and [[musical expression]] at the [[American University of Science and Technology]]. She appeared for the first time in the [[Studio El-Fan]] series debuts as a [[South Governorate|South Lebanese]] competitor from 2001–02. Abboud's musical career flourished with the release of her first album ''[[Fi Shouq]]'' ({{lang-ar|في شوق}}: on longing) published in late 2007.{{cite web|title=ليال عبود layal abboud|url=http://asraroki.com/2016/04/ليال-عبود/|website=asraroki.com/|publisher=Asraroki|accessdate=24 August 2017}} Sings in different [[Arabic dialects]], famous for her presentation of Lebanese folklore music and [[List of tours and concerts by Layal Abboud|internal summer concerts and tours]].{{cite web|title=The official lebanese Top 20 – Layal Abboud|url=http://www.theofficiallebanesetop20.com/Layal_Abboud#&panel1-3|website=The official lebanese Top 20}} Abboud is a singer member in the [[Syndicate of Professional Artists in Lebanon]].{{cite web|title=layale abboud|url=http://alfananine.com/index/?p=1099&lang=en|website=alfananine.com|publisher=Syndicate Of Professional Artists In Lebanon|accessdate=24 August 2017}} == Biography == === Early life and education === Layal Abboud was born into a large Muslim family on May 15, 1982 in the [[South Governorate|southern]] village of [[Kniseh, Tyre|Kanisah]] in Lebanon's [[Tyre District]]. Abboud's father and mother, named Mounir and Maryam, had three brothers and six sisters between them. As a child Abboud started singing and dancing and was a [[Fan (person)|fan]] of [[Egypt]]ian pop singer [[Amr Diab]].{{cite web|title=Al Kahera Wal Nas|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3LcMvesgyTM|website=youtube.com|publisher=You Tube|date=15 June 2017}} Her father encouraged her and bought her a violin while she was six years old.{{cite web |title=لا أرغب أن يخوض أطفالي تجربة الفن … ليال عبود لـ"الوطن": الأغنية الشعبية السورية متصدرة في سباق الأغاني العربية… ولأنها تستهويني لدي أغنية "مغنج" |url=http://alwatan.sy/archives/115221 |website=alwatan.sy |publisher=alwatan.sy |accessdate=19 June 2018 |date=15 August 2017}} Starting at age 14 she worked as a [[private tutor]] for more than 13 students.{{cite web|title=ليال عبود:وضع مسدساً في رأسي ولولا العناية الإلهية لما خرجتُ سالمة – ليالينا|url=https://www.layalina.com/ليال-عبودوضع-مسدساً-في-رأسي-ولولا-العناية-الإلهية-لما-خرجتُ-سالمة-0.html|website=ليالينا|language=ar}}{{Cite web |url=https://www.elfann.com/news/show/1182791/ليال-عبود:-كنت-الأمن-الداخلي..-وطليقي-حاول-يردعني |title=ليال عبود: كنت في الأمن الداخلي.. وطليقي حاول أن يردعني |website=elfann.com |publisher=El-Fann |access-date=25 August 2017}}{{cite web|title=ليال عبود: "نجرحت كتير لأنو قلبي طيب"..نيكولا داغر: "حلمي التلفزيون وكل شي بوقتو"|url=https://www.elfann.com/news/show/1092533/ليال-عبود:-نجرحت-كتير-لأنو-قلبي-طيب..نيكولا-داغر:-|website=Elfann News|publisher=Elfann News|language=ar-AR|date=July 23, 2014}} Abboud studied English literature at the [[Lebanese University]] and translation in [[Beirut Arab University]], graduating with a [[master's degree]].{{Cite web |url=https://www.elfann.com/news/show/1122897/ليال-عبود-:شيفرة-تمام-بليق-كانت-شيفرة-إما-أفتحها-ع |title=ليال عبود :"شيفرة تمام بليق كانت شيفرة إما أفتحها على نفسي أو أغلقها" |website=elfann.com |publisher=El-Fann |access-date=24 August 2017}} She went on to study music at the Lebanese National Higher Conservatory of music for two years. Abboud served as an [[Police officer|officer]] for the [[Internal Security Forces|Lebanese Police Force]], working security for two years in the [[Beirut–Rafic Hariri International Airport]]'s Inspection Department.{{cite web|title="سيدتي نت" تكشف سجلاّت ليال عبود في الشرطة اللبنانية|url=http://www.sayidaty.net/node/279736/فن-ومشاهير/أخبار-المشاهير/سيدتي-نت-تكشف-سجلاّت-ليال-عبود-في-الشرطة-اللبنانية|website=sayidaty.net|publisher=Sayidaty Magazine|accessdate=24 August 2017}}{{cite web|title=BAYNETNA / 2012 Layal Abboud|url=http://mtv.com.lb/Programs/Baynetna/2012/videos/Layal_Abboud/|website=mtv.com.lb|publisher=[[MTV Lebanon]]|language=Arabic|format=Interview|date=June 30, 2012}} === Musical career === Abboud appeared on TV for the first time on the hit show [[Studio El-Fan]] as a competitor for its 2001–02 season.{{Cite web |url=http://www.alittihad.ae/details.php?id=10749&y=2012&article=full |title=ليال عبود تتمنى تجسيد حياة مارلين مونرو وتستعد لألبوم جديد |website=alittihad.ae |publisher=Al-Ittihad |access-date=24 August 2017}} She sang at various Beirut cafés and restaurants, eventually networking with musicians like Richard Najm, Tony Abi Karam, and Salim Salameh.{{cite web|title=Layal – Fi Shouq|url=http://www.balaha-records.com/epages/61149572.sf/en_GB/?ObjectPath=/Shops/61149572/Products/BR-CD-02133|website=www.balaha-records.com|language=en}} Abboud went on to study music under Richard Najm, and in 2006 became a [[multi-instrumentalist]] skilled in the [[oud]], [[Organ (music)|organ]] and [[guitar]].{{cite web|title=ليال عبود: انسحبت من استديو الفن لأنطلق بقوة|url=http://jouhina.com/magazine/archive_article.php?id=103|publisher=Jouhina Magazine}} Her first album, ''[[Fi Shouq]]'' ({{lang-ar|في شوق}}: ''On Longing'') was released in late 2007. In an interview with Egyptian media about her [[penchant]] to [[music]], Abboud has stated, "[[Music]] is my [[life]]!" Abboud's inspirations include [[Ammar El Sherei]], [[Baligh Hamdi]] and [[Sabah (singer)|Sabah]]{{Cite web |url=http://www.alraimedia.com/ar/article/celebrities/2016/06/20/688465/nr/lebanon |title=ليال عبود: جنوني مُخيفٌ... ومُدمّر |website=alraimedia.com |publisher=[[Al Rai (Kuwaiti newspaper)|Al Rai]]|access-date=24 August 2017}} whom Abboud called the "ideal of my art career."{{cite web|title=ليال عبود: "لا أتمنى الوصول الى نهاية صباح وأنافس أم كلثوم|url=http://www.wen.co.il/ليال-عبود:-لا-أتمنى-الوصول-الى-نهاية-صباح-وأنافس-أم-كلثوم/28905.news|website=wen.co.il|publisher=wen}} In July 2014 Abboud also said that she is "very much drawn to French musicians, possibly because I’m a bit of a hopeless romantic." In addition to being a singer and musician, Abboud is also a poet and [[composer]], though says that she refrains from publishing her poetry or compositions in order to focus on her musical career as advised by her manager Dory Shehade. === Business and fashion === [[File:Layal Abboud - Plaza Palace Ceremony - Beirut - July 2015 - Lebanon 19.jpg|thumb|upright|Layal Abboud dressed by Akel Fakih, performing for [[Eid al-Fitr]] ceremony, [[Beirut]]; July 18, 2015.]] In 2014 Abboud called Akel Fakih "the mastermind" behind the way she dresses in her professional, social, and daily life. In 2015 Akel Fakih said he works with Layal Abboud "in a very distinctive and upscale way, going on to say that, "there is a chemistry that brings me together in fashion. She trusts my opinion and tastes, and this is one of the reasons why Layal chose me in her concerts."{{cite web|title=عقل فقيه :"غنّجت ليال عبّود بخمسة لوكات في عملها الجديد"|url=https://www.elfann.com/news/show/1132351/عقل-فقيه-:غنّجت-ليال-عبّود-بخمسة-لوكات-عملها-الجدي|website=Elfann News|publisher=Elfann News|language=ar-AR}} Abboud has elaborated on her fashion team, saying, "Elie Samaan does my hair and makeup; my stylist is Serene Assaad, and my photographer is Hussein Salman."{{cite web|title=Episode 29 – Layal Abboud Interview|url=https://www.lbcgroup.tv/watch/chapter/27354/47577/layal-abboud-interview/en|website=lbcgroup.tv|publisher=[[Lebanese Broadcasting Corporation International]]|accessdate=24 August 2017}}{{cite web|title=ماهي حقيقة خلاف ليال عبود و عقل فقيه ؟ {{!}} دنيا الوطن|url=https://www.alwatanvoice.com/arabic/news/2017/03/27/1032967.html|website=دنيا الوطن|publisher=Donia Al Watan|date=March 27, 2017}}
On 12 October 2017, She appeared publicly for the first as a fit and fashion model dressed and designed by Akl Fakih, in ''Design & Brands Event'' held at the Four Seasons Hotel of Beirut.{{cite web|title=ليال عبود تختار فستان زفاف من مجموعة عقل فقيه لعام 2018 {{!}} مجلة اليقظة|url=http://www.alyaqza.com/ليال-عبود-بفستان-زفاف-من-عقل-فقيه-لعام-2018/|website=www.alyaqza.com|publisher=alyaqza.com|accessdate=5 December 2017|language=ar|date=12 October 2017}}
Abboud is founder of [[Amman]]-based wedding planning company Loulou Secret. She also runs Layal Productions for her music. === Media issues === Sometimes called a [[Seduction|seductive artist]] and [[femme fatale]] by [[Al Akhbar (Lebanon)|Al Akhbar]] and other critics,{{cite web|title=وقفة {{!}} "نادين" عوني الكعكي: "بلاي بوي" لبناني!|url=http://www.al-akhbar.com/node/255780|website=الأخبار|language=ar}}{{cite web|title=تمام بليق... وزاد في الابتذال حتى انفلق|url=http://al-akhbar.com/node/227096|website=الأخبار|language=ar}}{{cite web|title=ليال عبود لـنادين الإشارة ركن أساسي عند الأنثي النجمة الأميركية فانيسا هادجنز بعد وفاة والدها كان لابد من تجاوز الأزمة|url=http://www.alanba.com.kw/ar/last/642037/11-04-2016-ليال-عبود-لـنادينالاشارة-ركن-اساسي-عند-الانثي-النجمة-الاميركية-فانيسا-هادجنز-بعد-وفاة-والدهاكان-لابد-تجاوز-الازمة|website=alanba.com.kw|language=ar}} Abboud appeared on the program ''Bala Teshfir'' on the [[Al Jadeed]] network in 2015, stating, "Being bold is not seduction".{{cite web|title=بلا تشفير حلقة ليال عبود|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1X7bS7BtPO4|website=youtube.com|publisher=You Tube|date=28 January 2017}}{{cite web|title=ليال عبود ترد على الأقلام الصفراء…|url=http://aldadpress.com/post/16269|website=الضاد برس|language=ar-AR|date=16 June 2015}} She believes there is a bias against her and said, "I am a normal artist and contemporary with [[fashion design|fashion]]."{{cite web|last1=Hasnaa|first1=Al|title=الحسناء {{!}} ليال عبود لـ "الحسناء": أضع بعض التصريحات تحت أقدامي لكي أرتفع أكثر|url=http://www.alhasnaa.com/news/subjects/فن-و-مشاهير/2017/02/24/ليال-عبود-ل-الحسناء-أضع-بعض-التصريحات-تحت-أقدامي-لكي-أرتفع-أكثر|website=الحسناء|language=ar}} In 2016 [[counterfeit]] images were published attributed to Abboud's likeness. She appointed attorney Haitham Tarshishi to file a [[lawsuit]] against "all those involved in the forgery of a picture attributed to her through [[social media]] sites, accompanied by words beyond the limits of fitness."{{cite web|title=ليال عبود توكل محامي للدفاع عن المسيئين لها بسبب صورتها المزيفة|url=http://www.sayidaty.net/node/419526/فن-ومشاهير/أخبار-المشاهير/ليال-عبود-توكل-محامي-للدفاع-عن-المسيئين-لها-بسبب-صورتها-المزيفة#photo/4|website=sayidaty.net|publisher=Sayidaty Magazine|accessdate=24 August 2017}} In August 2016 [[LBCI|the Lebanese Broadcasting Corporation]] reported that a suspect had been arrested.{{cite web|title=إلقاء القبض على مزوّر صورة|url=https://www.lbcgroup.tv/news/d/fann/278618/إلقاء-القبض-على-مزور-صورة-غير-لائقة-للفنانة-ليال-ع/ar|website=www.lbcgroup.tv|publisher=Lebanese Broadcasting Corporation International}} In April 2017 as a guest on the [[LBCI]] [[satire|satirical]] program ''La-hon Wa-bas'' hosted by Hicham Haddad, Abboud condemned an issue of ''[[Nadine Magazine]]'' for its depiction of her [[Female body shape|chest and face shape]] with the words, "Bigger than this chest" emblazoned on its cover, based on her quote while she used Arabic word of [[wikt:صدر#Arabic|ṣadr]] which can be an invocation for conscience and heart.{{cite web|title=وشوشة {{!}} ليال عبود تكشف حقيقة ما نشر عن صدرها في مجلة نادين Washwasha|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IDlNpDbM_cM|date=29 April 2016}} She accused the magazine of trying to increase readership by [[dumbing down]] and [[Oversimplification|oversimplifying]] its content.{{cite web|title=لبنان: عنوان بتلميحات جنسية لمجلة حول صورة ليال عبود يثير جدلاً واسعاً.. والفنانة ترد: قصدي شريف!|url=https://arabic.cnn.com/entertainment/2016/04/10/layal-abboud-magazine-cover|website=arabic.cnn.com|publisher=CNN Arabic|accessdate=24 August 2017}} Earlier in Jun 26, 2017 strongly criticized yellow-pens of Lebanese music journalists.{{Cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X-q4xxhdc0g&t=131s |title=حكي عالمكشوف مع الفنانة ليال عبّود |date=26 June 2017 |publisher=OTV Lebanon}} === Personal life === Moved to [[Beirut]] in 2009. Abboud cares about her [[physical health]] and [[elegance]].{{cite web|title=ليال عبود : الطبيعة صيدلية الجمال|url=http://www.anazahra.com/beauty/beauty-interviews/article-8027/ليال-عبود-الطبيعة-صيدلية-الجمال/|website=أنا زهرة}} In June 2017 she publicly confirmed that she had undergone [[rhinoplasty]], but that the rest of her features were not the result of plastic surgery, stating, "The secret of my beauty is sport".{{cite web|title=ليال عبود: جسمي كله طبيعي .. وسر جمالي الرياضة|url=http://www.face-msr.com/t~500741|website=face-msr.com|publisher=Face Misr|accessdate=24 August 2017}}{{cite web|title=شيخ الحارة ؛لقاء بسمة وهبه مع ليال عبود القاهرة والناس القاهرة والناس|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q7cTnAk54dI|website=youtube.com/|publisher=You Tube|accessdate=24 August 2017}} She is an advocate for a public [[smoking ban]] for Lebanon, saying, "Smoking and non-smoking areas must be allocated".{{cite web|title=ليال عبّود: "طَبخي" يُغنيني عن الدهون والحرمان|url=http://www.aljoumhouria.com/pages/view/96040|website=Al-Joumhouria|publisher=Al-Joumhouria}} Having had an interest in sport and [[horseback riding]] since childhood, Abboud has four horses, which she keeps in the village of Tanbourit in Lebanon's [[Sidon District]]. Their names are Rim, Loulou, Khaybar (named after [[Khaibar-1]] ) and Layal (named after her given name).{{Cite web |url=https://www.elfann.com/news/show/1154314/ليال-عبود-زوجي-خانني-وخفت-عنوان-أكبر-هيدا-الصدر |title=ليال عبود "زوجي خانني وخفت من عنوان "في أكبر من هيدا الصدر" |website=elfann.com |publisher=El-Fann}} Abboud is a practising Muslim.{{cite web |title=ليال عبود: جنوني مُخيفٌ... ومُدمّر! |url=http://www.alraimedia.com/Home/Details?Id=f7e0b6f9-088d-480c-a21b-73881b32bb0a |accessdate=19 June 2018 |date=20 June 2016}} She fasts and abstains from performing during [[Ramadan]], and holds the pre-dawn and post-sunset meals of [[Suhur]] and [[Iftar]] with her family.{{cite web|title=ليال عبود: أفطّر ستة أيتام في رمضان.. وأخدمهم|url=http://www.alhayat.com/Articles/15945048/ليال-عبود--أفطّر-ستة-أيتام-في-رمضان---وأخدمهم|website=alhayat.com/|publisher=[[Al-Hayat]]|date=June 7, 2016}}{{cite web|title=ليال عبود توزع الاغذية و الالعاب على الفقراء المزيد على دنيا الوطن .. |url=https://www.alwatanvoice.com/arabic/news/2017/06/20/1061157.html|website=alwatanvoice.com|publisher=دنيا الوطن – Donia Al Watan|accessdate=23 August 2017}} Involved in philanthropic activities {{cite web|title=ليال عبود تقديم وجبات للمتسولين في بيروت هؤلاء الأطفال أمانة في أعناقنا وتيلر سويفت تتصدر قائمة فوربس لاتزال متربعة في القمة|url=http://www.alanba.com.kw/ar/last/699932/18-11-2016-ليال-عبود-تقديم-وجبات-للمتسولين-بيروت-هؤلاء-الأطفال-أمانة-أعناقنا-وتيلر-سويفت-تتصدر-قائمة-فوربس-لاتزال-متربعة-القمة|website=alanba.com.kw|language=ar}} and has described herself as an "abnormal generous person." On Mid-January 2018 her home was burglarized and robbed of Jewelry and Cash, estimated at about 100,000 US $ by her assistant.{{cite news |title=مساعد ليال عبود يسرق مجوهراتها ويهددها... ''أفلام مشينة'' في هاتفه |url=https://www.annahar.com/article/735130-مساعد-ليال-عبود-يسرق-مجوهراتها-ويهددها-أفلام-مشينة-في-هاتفه |work=An-Nahar |date=17 January 2018}} === Marriage and family === Abboud married at the age of sixteen in 1998 and gave birth to her only son, Jad, in 2005.{{cite web|title=ليال عبود للمرة الأولى: جاد ابني وأخفيته عن الاعلام لهذا السبب!|url=https://aljaras.com/ليال-عبود-للمرة-الأولى-جاد-ابني-وأخفيت/|website=aljaras.com|publisher=Al-Jaras|accessdate=24 August 2017}} She eventually [[divorce in Islam|divorced]] her husband, later describing the marriage as "very formal," adding, "My early marriage was the result of a love story. I am a romantic and dreamy woman." In June 2017 she said, "By respect among us, we divorced and I chose my career in art." In August 2017 Abboud spoke about her relation with a Lebanese diplomat, saying that it had ended because of their divergent career paths.{{cite web|title=مجلة اليمامة|url=http://sites.alriyadh.com/alyamamah/article/1162128|website=sites.alriyadh.com|language=ar}} On May 5, 2015 said there is a [[Romance (love)|new love story]] in her life.{{cite web|title=خاص الفن- ليال عبود: أصبحت خجولة.. وأعيش قصة حب|url=http://www.elfann.com/news/show/1212352/خاص-الفن--%23ليال_عبود-أصبحت-خجولة..-وأعيش-قصة|website=elfann.com|language=ar}} About her relationship with her family, on June 15, 2017 said she was very much related to her father Mounir when lived between her family. But later when she grew up and had a son "who realized her mother's value", presented a song and gifted it to her mother, Maryam, which caused to her parent's return from staying in Saudi Arabia to Lebanon and decided to live close to each other.{{cite web|title=احتكار وغيرة وحسد.. ليال عبود تُهاجم الوسط الفني....عن علاقتها بعائلتها|url=http://www.rotana.net/tv-articles/احتكار-وغيرة-وحسد-ليال-عبود-تُهاجم-الو|website=rotana.net|language=ar}} == Discography == [[File:Layal Abboud - Maimes Festival, Lebanon - August 8, 2017 [[Royal Grammar School, High Wycombe]] |alma_mater = [[Anglia Ruskin University]] |employer = |occupation = [[Businessman]], [[politician]] |networth = US$1.71 billion (April 2018){{cite web|title=Michael Ashcroft|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/michael-ashcroft/|website=Forbes|accessdate=11 April 2015}} |title = |term = |predecessor = |successor = |party = [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative Party]] |spouse = {{marriage|Susan Anstey|1986}} |partner = |children = |parents = |relations = |awards = |signature = |signature_alt = |website = |footnotes = }} '''Michael Anthony P. Ashcroft, Baron Ashcroft''', {{postnominals|country=GBR|size=100%|sep=,|KCMG|PC}} (born 4 March 1946) is a [[British Citizen|British]]-[[Belize]]an [[businessman]] and [[politician]]. He is a former deputy [[chairman of the Conservative Party]]. Ashcroft founded Michael A. Ashcroft Associates in 1972{{Cite news|title = Ashcroft: The Tories' troublesome tycoon|url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/politics/696781.stm|work= BBC News|date = 31 March 2000|access-date = 5 January 2016}}{{Cite web|title = Inflation Calculator {{!}} Bank of England|url = http://www.bankofengland.co.uk/education/Pages/resources/inflationtools/calculator/flash/default.aspx|website = www.bankofengland.co.uk|accessdate = 5 January 2016}} and is the 95th richest person in the UK, as ranked by the [[Sunday Times Rich List 2017|''Sunday Times'' Rich List 2017]], with an estimated fortune of £1.35 billion.{{cite news |last=Vowles |first=Neil |title=Brexit fears unfounded as 1,000 richest get richer |url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/news/15271124.Brexit_fears_unfounded_as_1_000_richest_get_richer/ |accessdate=14 January 2018 |work=The Argus |date=8 May 2017}} He sat on the Conservative benches of the [[House of Lords]] until 2015, having been created a [[life peer]] in 2000. His peerage was controversial due to his status as a [[tax exile]].{{cite news | title = Ashcroft tax inquiry runs into buffers | last = White | first = Michael | work = [[The Guardian]] | location = London | date = 27 August 2002 | accessdate = 9 April 2015 | url = https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2002/aug/27/uk.conservatives }} The [[Cabinet Office]] stated that he would take up permanent residence in the UK for tax purposes, but it was reported a decade later that he had not done so.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/8542744.stm |title=Lord Ashcroft admits 'non-dom' status |accessdate=1 March 2010 |date=1 March 2010 |publisher=BBC News }} Ashcroft holds dual British and Belizean nationality, and is a [[Belonger status|belonger]] of the [[Turks and Caicos Islands]]. ==Biography== [[File:Lord Ashcroft Bust, LAIBS, Anglia Ruskin, 10 Oct, 2012.jpg|thumb|Ashcroft's [[bust (sculpture)|bust]] In the [[Lobby (room)|lobby]] of the Lord Ashcroft Building at the [[Lord Ashcroft International Business School|business school]] of [[Anglia Ruskin University]] in [[Cambridge]], from where he earned [[Higher National Diploma]] in [[business studies]].]] Born in [[Chichester]], [[West Sussex]], as his father Eric was a British colonial [[civil servant]], Ashcroft spent some of his early years in [[British Honduras]] (now [[Belize]]) and [[Malawi]]. He was educated at [[Norwich School (educational institution)|Norwich School]], [[Royal Grammar School, High Wycombe]], and [[Anglia Ruskin University|Mid-Essex Technical College (now Anglia Ruskin University)]], where he obtained a [[Higher National Diploma]] in [[Business studies]].Fran Abrams. "[https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/ashcroft-to-give-pound5m-to-his-old-college-718666.html Ashcroft to give £5m to his old college]". ''The Independent''. 25 May 2000. Retrieved 20 July 2011. ===Business career=== After a period in Belize after completing his education, Ashcroft returned to [[Hitchhiking|hitch hike]] around Europe, and then for a short period of time became the manager of a rock and roll band. In 1967, Ashcroft joined [[Carreras Tobacco Company|Carreras Tobacco]] as a management trainee.{{cite book|title=Dirty Politics Dirty Times|author=Michael Ashcroft|publisher=Biteback|date=8 July 2009|ISBN=1-84954-009-8|url=http://www.lordashcroft.com/pdf/dirtypoliticsdirtytimes_04112011.pdf}} He left in 1969, joining Pritchard Group Services, after several months unemployed. Pritchard Group was a cleaning and business services company and Ashcroft worked his way up quickly to become an assistant in the company's head office accounting department, part of a large acquisitions team. In 1972, at the age of 26, he started his own business, Michael A. Ashcroft Associates. His first acquisition was Uni-Kleen – a loss-making [[Housekeeping|cleaning]] company with one thousand employees, which he purchased for just £1 in 1974, with a £15,000 bank loan (or £176,780 in 2014-inflation adjusted terms). He worked to turn the company around, selling it just three years later for £1.3 million.{{cite web|url=http://www.managementtoday.co.uk/search/article/940641 |title=How he made his pile: Lord Ashcroft, businessman/politician |publisher=Management Today |date=1 October 2009 |accessdate=18 November 2017 }}"[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/696781.stm Ashcroft: The Tories' troublesome tycoon]". BBC News. 31 March 2000. Retrieved 12 April 2008. ===Hawley/ADT=== {{Main|ADT Security Services}} On exiting Uni-Kleen in 1977, his next purchase was Hawley Goodall, another poorly performing company, this time in camping equipment manufacture. Ashcroft used Hawley to make a series of acquisitions, transforming Hawley into a business services group, ranging from janitorial services for hospitals and offices, to [[car auction]] services, and later with a focus on the security services industry. Through the sale of the car auctions division to the fast-expanding [[British Car Auctions]], he formed a lifelong friendship with [[David Wickins]], whom he would later help take a majority stake in [[Lotus Cars]], as well as finance other joint-ventures.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2000/jan/16/thatcher.uk1|title=Ashcroft's Lotus position|author=Andy McSmith and Ben Laurance|work=[[The Observer]]|location=London|date=16 January 2000|accessdate=14 July 2012}} By 1981, Hawley had made its first acquisitions in the [[United States]], and its total revenues had grown to $27 million. By early 1983, Hawley had built up a 20% stake in pharmaceutical packaging manufacturer Cope Allman. Ashcroft offered to increase his stake to 29.9%, just below the 30% level at which a formal bid for the entire company must be launched. Ashcroft and Cope Allman fought bitterly over the purchase share price and current holdings, with Cope Allman reporting Ashcroft and Wickins to the [[Takeover panel]], after discovering that BCA had built up a 13.5% in the company. But the takeover panel found that the Ashcroft and Wickins were operating independently, so Hawley was able to increase its holding to 29.9%. At this point the combined holdings of Hawley/BCA in Cope Allman amounted to 43.5% per cent of Cope Allman, giving them the power to introduce sweeping changes without launching a full bid. Cope Allman was eventually sold to an MBO backed by Hawley and financed by [[Bain Capital]], and then sold to [[Rexam|Bowater]] in 1992 in a complex swap of assets with ADT/Hawley.{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/nhl-shareholders-not-told-of-executives-role-1558339.html|title=NHL shareholders not told of executive's role|work=[[The Independent]]|location=London|date=19 October 1992|accessdate=14 July 2012}} In 1985 Ashcroft and Wickins bought car sales dealership [[Henlys Group]] via a Canadian-registered company, Mipec. Controlled by Ashcroft's Hawley Goodall, Henlys was merged with the already owned funeral [[hearse]] maker [[Coleman Milne]] to form a Motoring Division. In 1989, Hawley Goodall sold its Motoring Division consisting of Henlys and [[Coleman Milne]] to the [[Plaxton]] Group, the bus and coach manufacturer based in [[Scarborough, North Yorkshire|Scarborough]], [[North Yorkshire]]. In 1986, Hawley bought out Ashcroft's former employer, Pritchard Services, leaping to the second place in the U.S. services industry. At this time, Hawley had revenues of more than $1.3 billion. 1987 was a key year for Hawley. In the early part of the year, it bought Crime Control Inc. based in Indianapolis, for $50 million, placing the company in fourth place in the U.S. security market. Later in the year it bought [[ADT Security Services]], the largest electronic security company in the United States. This purchase transformed Hawley into the leading security services business in the United States, and resulted in the majority of its revenues coming from the North American market. As a result of the acquisition, [[Bermuda]]-registered Hawley changed its name to ADT Inc. and decided to refocus its business around security services. At the end of 1987, the company sold its North American-based facility services business to [[Denmark]]'s [[ISS A/S]]. In 1987, Ashcroft bought out the existing shareholders of Wickins BCA via Hawley Goodall. Based at [[Blackbushe Airport]] to allow Wickins access to his treasured aviation division, which flew both [[Jet Ranger]] helicopters and [[Beechcraft King Air]] turbo prop aircraft, Ashcroft, who has a disliking for such flippant expenditure,{{Citation needed|date=December 2015}} immediately sold off the aircraft. Wickins joined the board of Hawley Goodall, remaining there until the Tyco takeover, but retired from BCA in 1990. In 1995, to allow for the Tyco transaction, the group decided to divest itself of BCA. The residual North American arm was sold to trade buyers, while the European arm was sold to a consortium of some 40 private investors, including Ashcroft via his Belize-based investment company. In September 2006, BCA was bought by the UK-based [[investment banking]] arm of private bank [[Samuel Montagu & Co.]], a division of [[HSBC]], personally netting Ashcroft over £200 million.{{cite web|url=http://news.sky.com/story/456572/ashcroft-in-for-bca-cash-windfall |title=Ashcroft In For BCA Cash Windfall |publisher=[[Sky News]] |date=20 September 2006 |accessdate=14 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140116073951/http://news.sky.com/story/456572/ashcroft-in-for-bca-cash-windfall |archivedate=16 January 2014 |df= }} In 1997, ADT was sold by a [[reverse takeover]] to US conglomerate [[Tyco International]] for $6.7 billion, allowing Tyco to become tax-efficient.{{cite news |title=The City spotlight falls once again on 'Daddy Warbucks' |author=Andrew Clark and Robert Shrimsley |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/htmlContent.jhtml?html=/archive/1999/07/14/nash114.html |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=14 July 1999 |accessdate=12 April 2008 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20020329225250/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/htmlContent.jhtml?html=%2Farchive%2F1999%2F07%2F14%2Fnash114.html |archivedate=29 March 2002 |location=London |deadurl=yes |df= }} Ashcroft disposed of large amounts of the Tyco stock which he had acquired as a result of the sale of ADT, explaining that he needed the capital to diversify into other things and that he never retained a substantial stake in any enterprise which he did not control. Ashcroft nevertheless continued as a non-executive director of Tyco, a role he still held in 2002 when Tyco CEO [[Dennis Kozlowski]] was arrested in New York in connection with personal tax offences. Unease had already been expressed at Tyco at some of Kozlowski's corporate decisions and Ashcroft was amongst the directors who appointed lawyer [[David Boies]] to investigate irregularities in the company.{{Citation needed|date=December 2015}} In time, the exposure of management deficiencies led to Ashcroft's demanding that the whole of the board of directors of Tyco should resign, to be replaced by new management. ===Belize and cross holdings=== Ashcroft has close business and other connections with the Commonwealth country of Belize, and served as the country's ambassador to the [[United Nations]] between 1998 and 2000. In his 2005 biography, he admitted that it is a country where his interests have been "exempt from certain taxes for 30 years."{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/top-stories/2008/09/27/exclusive-the-peer-who-bankrolls-the-tories-is-the-boss-of-a-poor-tax-haven-115875-20755178/|title=Exclusive: The peer who bankrolls the Tories is 'the boss' of a poor tax haven|work=Daily Mirror|location=London|date=27 September 2008|accessdate=18 December 2009}} In 2009, the [[Prime Minister of Belize]] [[Dean Barrow]] told its parliament:{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2009/nov/01/lord-ashcroft-belize-scrutiny|title='Lord Ashcroft of Belize' facing eviction as country turns on him|work=The Guardian|date=1 November 2009|accessdate=28 December 2009 | location=London | first=Jamie | last=Doward}} {{quote|Ashcroft is an extremely powerful man. His net worth may well be equal to Belize's entire GDP. He is nobody to cross.}} Barrow also warned [[David Cameron]] that relations with the [[United Kingdom]] would be damaged if Ashcroft were given a senior position in government.{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/belize-pm-warns-cameron-about-role-for-ashcroft-1830754.html|title=Belize PM warns Cameron about role for Ashcroft|work=The Independent|date=29 November 2009|accessdate=17 September 2010 | location=London | first=Jane | last=Merrick}} In 1981, Belize had gained independence from the UK. Seeing the opportunity to build an off-shore operations base and control the country's financial service, in 1984 Ashcroft formed Belize Holdings (BHI), which became the vehicle for a parallel acquisition spree during the 1980s, beyond the scope of Hawley. By the late 1980s, BHI had become one of the largest holding companies in Belize, with direct interests in or holdings via main operating company Stargate Ltd, ranging from telecommunications, property, the Belize shipping register, and citrus fruits. In 1987, BHI led the formation of Belize Bank Holdings (BBH), which took control of [[Belize Bank]] from the [[Royal Bank of Canada]]. Belize Bank has become the country's largest financial institution, controlling some 50 percent of the market. BBH developed local and international interests in facilities services, finance and telecommunications. Belize Bank itself formerly held a majority stake in [[Belize Telemedia]] Limited (BTL), until it was nationalised by the Government of Belize.{{cite web |url=http://www.governmentofbelize.gov.bz/download/pm_intro_bill.pdf |title=Prime Minister's Introduction of Bill to have Government assume control of Belize Telemedia Limited |publisher=Government of Belize |work= |accessdate=13 October 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} In 2005, under pressure from the Belize Government to bring transparency to its Belize based financial interests, BBH restructured, demerging its interests in England and Ireland into a separate company, Carlisle Group Ltd. BBH then renamed itself BCB Holdings. ===Other business activity=== Ashcroft also has significant interests in the following companies quoted on the [[Alternative Investment Market]]: [[Restore plc]], WeAre20:20{{cite web|title=Digital Marketing Group plc has changed its name to WEARE 2020 plc |url=http://weare2020.com/investors.aspx |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110526121419/http://weare2020.com/investors.aspx |archivedate=26 May 2011 |df=dmy }}{{cite web|title=Placing and admission to AIM |url=http://www.digitalmarketinggroup.co.uk/constitutionals/Digital_Marketing_Group_Admission_Final.pdf |publisher=Digital Marketing Group |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120327231208/http://www.digitalmarketinggroup.co.uk/constitutionals/Digital_Marketing_Group_Admission_Final.pdf |archivedate=27 March 2012 |df=dmy }}{{cite web|title=Michael Ashcroft – Business – WeAre20:20 plc|url=http://lordashcroft.com/business/weare2020plc.html}} and Impellam Group.{{cite web|title=Holding(s) in Company|url=http://www.advfn.com/p.php?pid=nmona&article=42258432&symbol=L%5EIPEL|publisher=advfn.com|accessdate=20 July 2011}} Having attempted a takeover Corporate Services Group in 1999, in June 2006 he increased his stake to 28.5%, prompting speculation that he might make an offer for the remaining shares in the company. In May 2008 the merger of Carlisle Group and Corporate Services Group to form [[Impellam Group]] was announced.Carlisle Group included the brands Recruit PLC and Tate. include [http://www.recruiter.co.uk/news/carlisle-and-csg-merge-under-impellam-banner/337045.article Carlisle Group and Corporate Services Group merged to form Impellam Group (Recruiter)] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111004182220/http://www.recruiter.co.uk/news/carlisle-and-csg-merge-under-impellam-banner/337045.article |date=4 October 2011 }} Listed on the Alternative Investment Market, the combined group places in excess of 40,000 people into work each week. In September 2007, Ashcroft agreed the sale of AIM listed cleaning services supplier [[OneSource (cleaning services supplier)|OneSource]]. Based mainly in the United States, it was the old North American cleaning business of ISS that Ashcroft had sold to them when refocusing Hawley in 1987. Bought in 1997 for $1, he agreed the sale of the company at a value of £179m.{{cite web|url=http://www.corpwatch.org/article.php?id=14748|title=UK: From $1 firm, Lord Ashcroft nets £132m|author=Simon Bowers|work=CorpWatch/Guardian|date=9 October 2007|accessdate=18 December 2009}} As of March 2006 he became the major shareholder in [[England|English]] professional [[football (soccer)|football]] club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], owning up to 42% of the club's shares.{{cite news |publisher=BBC Sport|title=Billionaire to own 42% of Watford |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/w/watford/4805978.stm |date=14 March 2006 |accessdate=14 March 2006 }} In September 2006, he accepted a bid for [[British Car Auctions]] (BCA) worth £450m, netting him a personal gain of £200m. In 2011, he became the main backer, along with Stephan Shakespeare (CEO and co-Founder of YouGov) of Flooved, an online education startup. ===Personal life=== [[File:VP-BZE (12484723295).jpg|thumb|VP-BZE, Ashcroft's private jet, at [[Birmingham Airport]] in 2014]] In April 1972, Ashcroft married Wendy Burrell in [[Hampstead]], north London.http://www2.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?r=244079895:8433&d=bmd_1441408475&scan=1 They had two sons and one daughter. His second marriage in 1986 was to Susan Anstey.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/politics/article5804861.ece|title=Tories accepted £250,000 from Lord Ashcroft's wife|work=The Times|date=25 February 2009|accessdate=18 December 2009 | location=London | first=Sam | last=Coates}} The couple have homes in London, [[Maidenhead]] in [[Berkshire]], and Belize. Ashcroft owns a [[Dassault Falcon 7X]], registration VP-BZE, via his [[Bermuda|Bermudian]] registered company, Flying Lion.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2007/nov/03/uk.conservatives|title=Welcome aboard Air Ashcroft, the Tories' favourite airline (just make sure you offset)|work=The Guardian|date=3 November 2007|accessdate=18 December 2009 | location=London | first=David | last=Hencke}} On 27 December 2017, while parked at the [[Malta International Airport]], the plane careened off the apron, smashed into a fence and a road before crashing into an office building. The incident is believed to have occurred after the plane's [[wheel chock]]s were blown away due to strong winds. No injuries were reported but the plane suffered extensive damage.{{cite news|last1=Vella|first1=Matthew|title=Private jet of Tory peer Lord Ashcroft 'taxies' off Malta runway into Polidano offices|url=http://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/83341/watch_parked_airplane_crashes_right_inside_polidano_offices_in_safi|work=[[Malta Today]]|date=27 December 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171227224027/http://www.maltatoday.com.mt/news/national/83341/watch_parked_airplane_crashes_right_inside_polidano_offices_in_safi|archivedate=27 December 2017|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|last1=Grech|first1=Herman|title=Aircraft blown off apron, smashes into building|url=https://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20171227/local/aircraft-skids-off-runway-smashes-into-building.666622|work=[[Times of Malta]]|date=27 December 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171227224054/https://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20171227/local/aircraft-skids-off-runway-smashes-into-building.666622|archivedate=27 December 2017|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} He owns two {{convert|150|ft|m|adj=on}} yachts, both registered in Belize: *''Lady M'' – built in the [[Netherlands]] *''Atlantic Goose'' – built originally for [[Donald Gosling|Sir Donald Gosling]] as ''Brave Goose'' in 1987 by Tough Brothers of [[Teddington]], on the [[River Thames]].{{cite web|url=http://www.yachtmati.com/atlantic-goose-tough/index.htm|title=Atlatic Goose|publisher=yachtmati.com|accessdate=18 December 2009}} On 30 January 1987, ''Brave Goose'' became wedged under the central arch of [[Richmond Bridge, London]], eventually being freed at [[low tide]] the next day.{{Harvnb|Cookson|2006|p=36}} ==Politics== ===Conservative Party=== In the UK, he was a major donor to and Treasurer of the [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative Party]] from 1998 to 2001, under [[William Hague]]. His tenure was marked by a number of controversies: he was seen to pay little UK [[income tax]] because of his domicile in Belize; and he was at the centre of a debate about openness and accountability of political funding. Unsubstantiated speculation about his business affairs was concluded when he pursued a libel action against ''[[The Times]]''. This was settled on 9 December 1999, when ''The Times'' issued a front-page statement saying "The Times is pleased to confirm that it has no evidence that Mr Ashcroft or any of his companies have ever been suspected of money-laundering or drug-related crimes... Litigation between the parties has been settled to mutual satisfaction, with each side bearing its own costs."{{cite news |author=Colin Brown |title=Ashcroft offers to 'reorganise affairs' in libel case settlement |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/ashcroft-offers-to-reorganise-affairs-in-libel-case-settlement-738547.html |work=The Independent |date=9 December 1999 |accessdate=16 December 2011 |location=London}}{{cite news |authors=Kevin Maguire, Nick Hopkins and Paul Murphy |title=Dramatic end to Ashcroft and Times libel battle |url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/1999/dec/09/thatcher.uk2 |work=The Guardian |date=9 December 1999 |accessdate=23 April 2008 | location=London}} In 2004, he clashed with Conservative leader [[Michael Howard]] when he offered a £2m donation on the condition that it should go to his specified candidates rather than into general [[Conservative Campaign Headquarters|Conservative Central Office]] funds. Ashcroft stated in 2005: "I much prefer to be involved, to make sure that my investment is wisely placed."{{Citation | last = Brogan | first = Benedict | title = How the charity of a peer's wife will propel Cameron to power | newspaper = The Daily Telegraph | date = 27 January 2010 | url = https://www.telegraph.co.uk/comment/columnists/benedict-brogan/7086643/How-the-charity-of-a-peers-wife-will-propel-Cameron-to-power.html | accessdate =31 January 2010 | location=London}} In December 2005, he was appointed [[Chairman of the Conservative Party|Deputy Chairman]] of the [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative Party]].{{cite web | authorlink = Conservative Party (UK) | title = The Lord Ashcroft KCMG—Profile | publisher = Conservative Party | url = http://www.conservatives.com/People/Peers/Ashcroft_Michael.aspx | accessdate =12 April 2008}} During the "[[Cash for Peerages]]" controversy, on 31 March 2006 Ashcroft was named by the Conservative Party as having loaned it £3.6m. On 12 October 2007 he was accused by [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] MPs of being allowed to heavily fund local Conservative organisations in marginal seats of his choosing. Ashcroft has insisted such funding is legitimate. Significant donations made to the Conservative Party by Bearwood Corporate Services, a company controlled by Ashcroft, have also come under scrutiny. The trading status of the company, and thus the validity of donations totalling £5.1m between 2003 and 2008, is unclear and became the subject of an investigation by the Electoral Commission begun in October 2008. Both Labour MPs and the [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Prime Minister]] had called for the process to be concluded in time for the [[United Kingdom general election, 2010|next general election]], due by mid-2010. [[Liberal Democrats (UK)|Liberal Democrat]] [[Matthew Oakeshott, Baron Oakeshott of Seagrove Bay|Lord Oakeshott]] stated: "Democracy is in danger if Lord Ashcroft has been pouring millions into Conservative campaigns through an offshore pipeline from a Caribbean [[tax haven]]."{{Citation | last1 = Syal | first1 = Rajeev | last2 = Helm | first2 = Toby | title = Electoral watchdog under fire as Lord Ashcroft inquiry threatens to run into election | newspaper = The Guardian | date = 15 November 2009 | url = https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2009/nov/15/lord-ashcroft-donations-inquiry | accessdate =31 January 2010 | location=London}}{{Citation | last1 = Helm | first1 = Toby | last2 = Syal | first2 = Rajeev | title = Gordon Brown attacks 'scandal' of Lord Ashcroft donations | newspaper = The Guardian | date = 7 February 2010 | url = https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2010/feb/07/gordon-brown-ashcroft-donations-scandal | accessdate =7 February 2010 | location=London}} However, in March 2010 sources from the Electoral Commission described the donations as being "legal and permissible".{{Citation |title = Donation probe 'clears Ashcroft'|publisher=BBC News | date = 4 March 2010 | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/8549243.stm| accessdate =4 March 2010 }} On 1 March 2010, Ashcroft admitted that he was not domiciled in the UK for tax purposes. On 4 March 2010 the [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom|House of Commons]] Public Administration [[Select Committee (Westminster System)|Select committee]] decided to hold a "special one-off inquiry" into Ashcroft's peerage and his tax affairs. The committee's three Conservative MPs are said to have refused to take part in the inquiry.{{Citation | last1 = Elliott | first1 = Francis | last2 = Kennedy | first2 = Dominic | title = Conservative officials 'refused to co-operate with Ashcroft inquiry' | newspaper = The Times | date = 5 March 2010 | url = http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/politics/article7050508.ece | accessdate =5 March 2010 | location=London}} In September 2010, Ashcroft announced he would be stepping down as Deputy Chairman of the Conservative Party. His resignation came as he published [http://lordashcroftpolls.com/2010/09/minority-verdict/ Minority Verdict], his critical analysis of why the Conservative Party failed to gain an overall majority in the [[United Kingdom general election, 2010|general election]]; leading to the Conservatives forming the [[Coalition Government 2010–2015|Coalition government]] with [[Liberal Democrats (UK)|the Liberal Democrats]]. He was replaced by the Conservative MP, former government minister and the current [[Treasury Select Committee|Treasury Select Committee member]], [[Michael Fallon]].{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/politics/conservative/8018673/Michael-Fallon-named-Conservative-Party-deputy-chairman.html|title=Michael Fallon named Conservative Party deputy chairman|date=22 September 2010|work=The Daily Telegraph|location=London}} In 2012, the ''Daily Telegraph'' credited Ashcroft, owner of both the [[ConservativeHome]] and PoliticsHome website with "stopping the Coalition working" by moving policy on Europe, welfare, education, taxation to the right.{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/david-cameron/9359539/Lord-Ashcrofts-Tory-Right-is-stopping-the-Coalition-working.html|title=Lord Ashcroft’s Tory Right is stopping the Coalition working|author=Oborne, Peter|work=The Daily Telegraph|location=London|date=27 June 2012|accessdate=30 June 2012}} Prior to the 2010 election, Cameron gave Ashcroft a large office and a significant role in the election campaign but he received no reward in the form of ministerial job. Although claiming not to exercise editorial control, Ashcroft, a "brutal critic of the Coalition from the start" has established "megaphone presence" in the online media and the Lib Dems are described as blocking economic and welfare system reforms. The parties have separate and contradictory agendas and--as exemplified by [[Michael Gove]]'s education reforms intended for Tory ears only'-do not even consult each other. Cameron's philosophy of liberal conservatism has been destroyed by "coordinated attacks on the Coalition." Although voters may have liked Coalition government, "the two parties are no longer trying to pretend that they are governing together" and Cameron seems unwilling to celebrate midterm successes. "Ashcroft, who has been against it all along, looks like getting his way." ===Belize=== Ashcroft allegedly gave the [[People's United Party]] in Belize $1m when it was in opposition. During its period in power, it introduced laws that are claimed by opponents and media commentators to be financially advantageous to Ashcroft. ===Australia=== Ashcroft has become a significant figure in Australian politics having been identified as the single largest individual donor to any Australian political party during the Financial Year 2004/2005. The [[Australian Electoral Commission]] reported in February 2006 that Ashcroft (who gave his address as "House of Lords, Westminster, London") had donated $1 million to the [[Liberal Party of Australia|Liberal Party]] in September 2004 just before the 2004 Federal election. It was the biggest single disclosed private donation in Australian political history.[http://fadar.aec.gov.au/Returns/7/D6976.pdf Lord Ashcroft KCMG Annual Return] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070703193801/http://fadar.aec.gov.au/Returns/7/D6976.pdf |date=3 July 2007 }} (PDF) at Annual Returns Locator Service He also donated $250,000 to the [[Liberal Party of Australia|Liberal Party]] on 28 July 2010. ===UK electoral polling=== Developing from work he did for the Conservative Party in his Deputy Chairman role, since 2010{{cite web|last1=Ashcroft|first1=Michael|title=About|url=http://lordashcroftpolls.com/about/|website=Lord Ashcroft Polls|accessdate=14 January 2015}} Lord Ashcroft has been a major independent public pollster of British political opinion. This has included polling at [[constituency]] level, which is rare in British [[psephology]].{{cite news|title=Above the fray|url=https://www.economist.com/news/britain/21638111-conservatives-former-deputy-chairman-lord-ashcroft-thriving-pollster-above-fray|accessdate=14 January 2015|work=The Economist|date=10 January 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Pickard|first1=Jim|title=Lord Ashcroft becomes independent opinion pollster|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/fb5141fe-89da-11e4-9dbf-00144feabdc0.html|accessdate=14 January 2015|work=Financial Times|date=22 December 2014}} Lord Ashcroft Polls' results are freely available online{{cite web|last1=Ashcroft|first1=Michael|title=Home|url=http://lordashcroftpolls.com|website=Lord Ashcroft Polls|accessdate=14 January 2015}} and are frequently discussed in various media outlets. For example: {{cite news|last1=Hope|first1=Christopher|title=General Election 2015: Tories grab six point lead over Labour in Lord Ashcroft poll|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/conservative/11340711/General-Election-2015-Tories-grab-six-point-lead-over-Labour-in-Lord-Ashcroft-poll.html|accessdate=14 January 2015|work=The Daily Telegraph|location=London|date=12 January 2015}}, {{cite news|title=Explore all of Lord Ashcroft's 89 marginal polls|url=http://www.newstatesman.com/politics/2014/11/explore-all-lord-ashcrofts-89-marginal-polls|accessdate=14 January 2015|work=New Statesman|date=7 November 2014}} ==Charity and philanthropy== In 2013, Ashcroft stated that he has given tens of millions of pounds to good causes over the years.{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/personalfinance/10037208/Lord-Ashcroft-I-have-never-been-a-great-believer-in-inherited-wealth.html|title=Lord Ashcroft: 'I have never been a great believer in inherited wealth'|author=Ashcroft, Michael|work=The Daily Telegraph|location=London|date=4 May 2013|accessdate=19 July 2013}} In May 2013, he pledged to donate more than half of his money to good causes, and became a signatory of [[The Giving Pledge]].{{cite web|url=http://givingpledge.org/pdf/letters/Ashcroft_Letter.pdf |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130702151341/http://givingpledge.org/pdf/letters/Ashcroft_Letter.pdf |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2 July 2013 |title=Statement from Lord Ashcroft KCMG PC: May, 2013 |author= |publisher=''The Giving Pledge'' |date=May 2013 |accessdate=19 July 2013 }} ===Anti-crime supporter=== Lord Ashcroft is the founder and chairman of [[Crimestoppers UK|Crimestoppers]]. On 12 October 2009, Lord Ashcroft pledged NZ$50,000 for the safe return of two-year-old toddler [[Aisling Symes]]. Aisling had gone missing a week earlier in [[West Auckland]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=10602789|title=$50,000 reward offered in Aisling Symes case|work=[[The New Zealand Herald]]|date=12 October 2009|accessdate=13 October 2009}} ===Education=== [[File:Anglia Polytechnic University - geograph.org.uk - 48187.jpg|thumb|[[Anglia Ruskin University]]'s Michael A. Ashcroft Building, opened in 2002 in Chelmsford. It houses the Lord Ashcroft International Business School.]] Ashcroft has been Chancellor of Anglia Ruskin University since November 2001.{{cite web|url=http://www.anglia.ac.uk/ruskin/en/home/microsites/honorary/ashcroft.html|title=Lord Ashcroft|publisher=Anglia Ruskin University|accessdate=18 December 2009}} He donated £5 million in 1999 for the university's business school at [[Chelmsford]], now called [[Lord Ashcroft International Business School]], and another £5million gift in 2009 to create a new business school in Cambridge.{{citation needed|date=January 2018}} He is the sponsor of [[Ashcroft Technology Academy]] in Wandsworth, a state secondary school within the English [[Academy (English school)|academy]] programme.{{EW charity|281159|PROSPECT EDUCATION (TECHNOLOGY) TRUST LIMITED}} He became the main backer, along with [[Stephan Shakespeare]] (CEO and co-Founder of [[YouGov]]) of Flooved, an [[Ed tech]] Startup. He has provided a copy of ''Britain's Treasure Islands'' to every secondary school in the UK and its overseas territories.{{cite web|title=Britain's Treasure Islands|url=http://www.britainstreasureislands.com/project/lord-michael-ashcroft|work=britainstreasureislands.com}} Ashcroft is also an Ambassador for the education and veterans charity [[SkillForce]] which, under Chief Executive, [[Ben Slade]] devised and developed the [[Prince William Award]] - the only award of its kind in William's name. ===Environmentalist=== Ashcroft is a [[whale]] spotter, through which interest he has financially supported various environmental groups and campaigns. He financially supported the [[Environmental Investigation Agency]], who persuaded him to back a television campaign in six Caribbean countries, aimed at coaxing them to withdraw their support for whaling. The countries had received $16 million (£8 million) a year in [[Whaling in Japan#Normalization|fisheries aid from Japan]]. The campaign coincided with the 2006 [[International Whaling Commission]] conference in [[St Kitts]].{{cite news|url=http://business.timesonline.co.uk/tol/business/industry_sectors/natural_resources/article1690260.ece|title=The unexpected face of fight to save the whales |work=[[The Times]] |accessdate=18 December 2009 | location=London | first=Nick | last=Hasell | date=23 April 2007| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20080907202847/http://business.timesonline.co.uk/tol/business/industry_sectors/natural_resources/article1690260.ece| archivedate= 7 September 2008}} ===Military=== Ashcroft has also supported military causes; in September 2011 he hosted a reception at the House of Lords for the launch of the Felix Fund, the charity for [[bomb disposal]] experts and their families.{{cite web|url=http://www.felixfund.org.uk/2011/09/28/felix-fund-launch-raises-55000/|title=Felix Fund Launch raises £55,000|work=Felix Fund - The Bomb Disposal Charity}}{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/onthefrontline/8753256/Launch-of-1m-appeal-for-our-bomb-disposal-heroes.html|title=Launch of £1m appeal for our bomb disposal heroes|date=10 September 2011|work=The Daily Telegraph|location=London}} Ashcroft pledged to donate all of the author's royalties from his book ''Special Forces Heroes'' to the [[Help for Heroes]] charity,[http://www.helpforheroes.org.uk/latest-news-archive/latest_news_5.html Help for Heroes – Latest News 5] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20120802154208/http://www.helpforheroes.org.uk/latest-news-archive/latest_news_5.html |date=2 August 2012 }} and from his book, ''George Cross Heroes'' to the [[Victoria Cross and George Cross Association]]. He donated £1 million of the £7 million cost of the [[Bomber Command Memorial]] in London's [[Green Park]], and his contribution is recognised on each side of the memorial. ==Victoria Crosses== Ashcroft collects [[Victoria Cross]]es which are awarded for valour and devotion to duty to members of various armed forces.{{Cite news|title=All Awards and Accreditation notices, Victoria Cross (VC) |newspaper=The Gazette, Official Public Record |url=https://www.thegazette.co.uk/awards-and-accreditation/content/10007 |access-date=20 May 2016 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} His collection is by far the largest in the world{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/2270310/World%27s-largest-VC-collection-to-go-on-show.html |title=World's largest VC collection to go on show |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |date=8 July 2008 |first=Andrew |last=Pierce |accessdate=9 July 2008 | location=London}} spanning 128 years from acts of valour at the start of the [[Crimean War]] in 1854 to an act of courage during the [[Falklands War]] in 1982. He wrote ''Victoria Cross Heroes'',{{cite book | date = 6 November 2006 | title = Victoria Cross Heroes: Men of Valour | last = Ashcroft | first = Michael | publisher = [[Headline Publishing]] (hardcover) | isbn = 978-0-7553-1632-8}} to mark the 150th anniversary of the Victoria Cross. Following the theft of a number of Victoria Crosses awarded to New Zealand servicemen from the [[National Army Museum (New Zealand)|Army Museum at Waiouru]] in late 2007, Ashcroft pledged NZ$200,000 for their return. Those stolen included the VC & Bar of [[Charles Upham]]. The medals were recovered three months later and at a presentation in Wellington on 15 April 2008 he pledged a further NZ$200,000 for information leading to the conviction of those responsible for the thefts. In July 2008, Ashcroft announced a donation of £5 million for a permanent gallery at the [[Imperial War Museum]], where the fifty Victoria Crosses held by the museum are now on display alongside his own collection of 162 VCs.{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/comment/personal-view/3560402/Never-forget-the-winners-of-the-Victoria-Cross.html|title=Never forget the winners of the Victoria Cross|author=Ashcroft, Michael|date=11 July 2008|work=The Daily Telegraph|location=London}} ==Controversy== ===Tax status=== Ashcroft has been described as a "[[tax exile]]", and for a number of years lived in the UK enjoying the controversial [[List of people with non-domiciled status in the UK|non-domiciled tax status]]. At the time of his ennoblement the Cabinet Office said that Ashcroft would be taking up permanent residence in the UK for tax purposes, an undertaking described in the newspapers as a "pledge" and a "gentleman's agreement", but he did not in fact claim to do so until a decade later,{{Cite web | title = Tory donor Lord Ashcroft gives up non-dom tax status | work = [[BBC News]] | date = 7 July 2010 | accessdate = 9 April 2015 | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/10535852 | quote = Lord Ashcroft has given up his non-dom tax status to stay in the Lords, it has been confirmed. }} when a change in the law would have required him to quit the Lords, had he not done so. Then in 2017 it was revealed following the [[Paradise Papers]] leak of offshore investment documents that Lord Ashcroft remained a domicile of Belize despite having claimed to have given up his non-dom tax status in 2010.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-41879422|title=Paradise Papers: Lord Ashcroft stayed non-dom despite pledges|author= Paradise Papers reporting team|date=5 November 2017}} ===U.S. DEA leak fiasco=== In 1999, Ashcroft was first nominated by Conservative Party leader and friend [[William Hague]] for the Lords. During their investigation, the [[House of Lords Appointments Commission]] was fed certain information via the media, which originated from Jonathan Randel, an intelligence research specialist for the United States [[Drug Enforcement Administration]].{{Citation needed|date=December 2009}} Randel leaked Ashcroft's name as being in the DEA's files, although it later emerged that Ashcroft was one of five million people they routinely had files on. Randel claimed that the DEA was ignoring Ashcroft in its investigation of [[money laundering]], allegations which ''[[The Times]]'' newspaper later printed on its front page. However, later investigation by various British media sources from information released under the [[Freedom of Information Act (United States)|US Freedom of Information Act]] showed that at no point did the DEA personally investigate Ashcroft.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/ashcroft/ |title=Lord Ashcroft |work=The Guardian |accessdate=18 December 2009 | location=London | date=22 September 2008}} After his second successful nomination to the Lords and his ascent to the house, Ashcroft sued ''The Times'' in the High Court. The two parties eventually reached an out of court agreement which resulted in [[Rupert Murdoch]] agreeing to ''The Times'' printing a full front page retraction of its allegations.{{cite web|url=http://www.historycommons.org/entity.jsp?entity=michael_ashcroft_1|title=Michael Ashcroft – December 8, 1999 "Murdoch Settles Libel Lawsuit"|publisher=History Commons|accessdate=18 December 2009}} Ashcroft later recounted his own side of the story in his book, ''Dirty Politics, Dirty Times.'' ===Business style=== In 2003, Ashcroft was criticised by the [[High Court judge (England and Wales)|High Court judge]], Mr Justice [[Peter Smith (judge)|Peter Smith]] in ''[[Rock (Nominees) Ltd v RCO (Holdings) Plc]]''.[2003] EWHC 936 (Ch), upheld in the Court of Appeal [2004] EWCA Civ 118, however Jonathan Parker LJ said, "That being so, it was in my judgment unnecessary and inappropriate for the judge to have expressed himself in such extreme language. However, the fact that he chose to express himself as he did has no impact on the conclusion which he reached on the issue of undervalue: a conclusion which, for the reasons I have given, was in my judgment plainly correct." Smith condemned Ashcroft's tactics in relation to the takeover of cleaning company RCO by the Danish firm ISS. Smith said, {{blockquote|Euphemistically this practice — which I understand is a not unheard-of practice in the City — is described as "[[greenmail]]". The proper word to my mind is blackmail. It is the kind of thing which brings the City into disrepute ... Where matters are dealt with in speculation and profits are made, which are then gathered offshore, when there is no merit and no exposure to the kind of risks associated with companies, that to my mind is not legitimate.|sign=Justice Peter Smith}} Smith went on to say that Ashcroft "was not content with a small £250,000 profit earned in a matter of weeks. He now seeks to extract millions."{{cite news |first=Conal |last=Walsh |author2=Antony Barnett |title=Ghost of Gekko in Ashcroft's greenmail |work=[[The Observer]] |date=11 May 2003 |accessdate=12 July 2009 |url=https://www.theguardian.com/business/2003/may/11/theobserver.observerbusiness | location=London}} Ashcroft responded by telling journalists that "being accused of blackmail by a man who states that speculation has no part to play in the City is rather like finding that you are sharing a railway carriage with a drunk. It's best not to take too much notice." In 2008, ''The Economist'' ran an article on the web of loans and court cases surrounding Belize Bank (owned by Ashcroft), a private hospital company called Universal Health Services and the government of Belize. It was alleged that Belize Bank had wrongly appropriated monies sent from the government of Venezuela for housing purposes in order to settle debts relating to loans to UHS and illegally guaranteed in secret by the Belizean premier.{{cite news|url=http://www.economist.com/node/11377008|title=A $10m mystery-What connects the deputy-chairman of the Conservative Party with Hugo Chávez|work=The Economist|date=15 May 2008|accessdate=1 April 2015}} On 5 March 2010, Ashcroft was accused of avoiding VAT on opinion polls he commissioned for the Conservatives in 2005. The polls were carried out by [[YouGov]] and [[Populus]], and are believed to have cost in the region of £250,000. ''The Guardian'' said that sources claimed the bills were paid by a company owned by Ashcroft in Belize, meaning that he did not pay VAT. The newspaper estimated that the total VAT bill could have totalled more than £40,000, however, paying the bill in this way removed the legal obligation to pay VAT.{{cite news|url=http://www.newstatesman.com/2010/03/ashcroft-party-vat-polling|title=Lord Ashcroft has been accused of avoiding VAT on opinion polls|date=5 March 2010|accessdate=8 March 2010}} In 2012, BBC's ''Panorama'' programme alleged that Lord Ashcroft continued to control the Caribbean construction company, Johnston International, after its sale in 1999 until it went bankrupt in 2010, and that he concealed his continuing control. Ashcroft denied he owned Johnston after 1999 but ignored questions about whether he continued to 'control' it.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-16732528|title=Tory Lord Ashcroft 'concealed link to Caribbean firm'|work=BBC News}} ===''Call Me Dave''=== Ashcroft's book ''[[Call Me Dave|Call Me Dave: The unauthorised biography of David Cameron]]'', published on 5 October 2015, has been criticised for containing content which lacks evidence.{{cite news|title = Conservative sources deny David Cameron pig’s head allegations|url = https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2015/sep/21/conservative-sources-deny-david-cameron-pigs-head-allegations|work=The Guardian|accessdate = 26 September 2015|first = Rowena|last = Mason|first2 = Patrick|last2 = Wintour}} In addition to this, some commentators believe Ashcroft published the book to tarnish David Cameron's reputation.{{Cite web|title = David Cameron biography: No 10 refuses to comment on debauchery claims|url = https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2015/sep/21/david-cameron-biography-downing-st-debauchery-claims|work=The Guardian|accessdate = 26 September 2015|first = Patrick|last = Wintour|first2 = Rowena|last2 = Mason}} The book triggered the "[[Piggate]]" scandal with an allegation that a photograph exists which shows Cameron putting "a private part of his anatomy" into the mouth of a dead pig's severed head, which was positioned in the lap of another man.[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3242550/Cameron-pig-bemused-look-face-future-PM-took-outrageous-initiation-ceremony-joining-Oxford-dining-society.html British Prime Minister and an obscene act with a dead pig's head: How David Cameron took part in sordid initiation ceremony after joining Oxford University dining society as a student.] ''Daily Mail''. Michael Ashcroft and Isabel Oakeshott. 20 September 2015 ==Honours and styles of address== ===Honours=== On 31 March 2000, Ashcroft was appointed as a [[life peer]],{{London Gazette|issue=55806 |supp=y |page=11959|date=25 October 2000}} and the title '''Baron Ashcroft''', of Chichester in the County of West Sussex was [[London Gazette|gazetted]] on 20 October 2000.{{London Gazette|issue=56008 |page=11959|date=25 October 2000}} His appointment to the House of Lords was controversial at the time, particularly because of his business and political interests in Belize; the body responsible for scrutiny of political honours had refused his becoming a member of the Lords one year earlier. He was nominated by Conservative party leader [[William Hague]] on the condition that he became a UK resident although at the beginning of 2010 he announced his "non-domiciled" tax status. Ashcroft had announced that he intended to take the title "Baron Ashcroft of Belize", a suggestion that infuriated his political opponents. He later said this had been a joke, and his title was created as simply "Baron Ashcroft".{{cite news | title = Ashcroft inquiry called off | publisher = [[BBC News]] | date = 27 August 2002 | accessdate = 9 April 2015 | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/2218803.stm }} In the 2000 [[Queen's Birthday Honours]], on the advice of the Belizean government, he was appointed [[Knight Commander of the Order of St Michael and St George]] (KCMG) "for public service to the community and country" of Belize.{{London Gazette|issue=55879 |page=40|date=19 June 2000}} In 1999, he was given the [[Honorary Degree]] of [[Doctor of the University]] by [[Anglia Ruskin University]], he would be named [[Chancellor (education)|Chancellor]] of the University in 2001.{{cite web|url=http://ww2.anglia.ac.uk/ruskin/en/home/microsites/honorary/ashcroft.html |title=Anglia Ruskin University's Honorary Graduate Site |work=anglia.ac.uk |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150518083429/http://ww2.anglia.ac.uk/ruskin/en/home/microsites/honorary/ashcroft.html |archivedate=18 May 2015 |df=dmy }} He was sworn in as a member of the [[Privy Council of the United Kingdom]] in 2012, entitling him to use the [[List of post-nominal letters (United Kingdom)|post-nominal letters]] "PC" for life. On 31 March 2015, the day after the prorogation of Parliament ahead of the [[United Kingdom general election, 2015|2015 general election]], he announced his resignation from the House of Lords with immediate effect, stating he would continue in politics.{{Cite web | date = 31 March 2015 | accessdate = 9 April 2015 | title = Personal Statement from Lord Ashcroft KCMG PC | author=Lord Ashcroft KCMG PC | url=http://www.lordashcroft.com/2015/03/personal-statement-from-lord-ashcroft-kcmg-pc/}}{{cite news | title = Former Tory treasurer Lord Ashcroft has resigned from the House of Lords | last {{Infobox company | name = Our Generation Speaks | logo = | type = Non-profit Organization | founded = 2014 in [[Waltham, Massachusetts]] | founder = [[Ohad Elhelo]] | hq_location_city = [[Waltham, Massachusetts]] | website = [http://www.ogspeaks.com www.ogspeaks.com] }} '''Our Generation Speaks''' ('''OGS''') is a fellowship program and startup incubator whose mіѕѕіоn іѕ to bring together young [[Israelis|Israeli]] and [[Palestinian people|Palestinian]] leaders through entrepreneurship.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ogspeaks.com/about-ogs|title=Our Generation Speaks|publisher=}}</ref> OGS works in partnership with the [[Heller School for Social Policy and Management]] ([[Brandeis University]]) <ref>{{cite web|url=http://heller.brandeis.edu/about/ourgenerationspeaks/|title=Our Generation Speaks – The Heller School at Brandeis University|publisher=}}</ref> and [[MassChallenge]] <ref name=":0">{{cite web|last1=Kirsner|first1=Scott|title=Can entrepreneurship bridge the Israeli-Palestinian gap?|url=http://www.betaboston.com/news/2016/03/10/can-enterpeneurship-bridge-the-israeli-palestinian-gap/|publisher=The Boston Globe - BetaBoston|accessdate=7 February 2017}}</ref> to give OGS Fellows the tools to develop businesses that generate significant social and economic value in the [[Middle East]].
== Structure == OGS teaches business development, financial management, marketing strategy, and conflict-resolution to young adults aged 21–30. The fellowship runs over the course of three months in [[Waltham, Massachusetts]] and includes daily classes taught by Brandeis University professors, one-on-one mentoring, and workshops. During the summer, the fellows work in teams to build sustainable businesses that will benefit their home communities. The fellowship operates entirely in English and provides each group of fellows with the skills and network to enact change in their communities. Each business developed through OGS receives seed funding at the end of the fellowship to aid in their launch and operations upon return to Israel and Palestine.
OGS Fellows remain connected through the OGS Alumni Organization, which plans a number of annual activities, including group trips in Israel and Palestine, meetings with local leaders, and trainings focused on career and leadership development. The organization will host an annual conference for current fellowship participants and the growing group of alumni over time.<ref name=":2">{{cite web|title=Our Work|url=http://www.ogspeaks.com|website=Our Generation Speaks|accessdate=9 February 2017}}</ref>
The OGS Fellows are exceptional young adults from both Israel and Palestine. OGS uses entrepreneurship to bring together people from these communities, which in turn works toward building trust and enacting social and economic change. Each year, OGS aims to maintain a 1:1 ratio of Israeli and Palestinians, as well as female and male fellows.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/his-generation-speaks-qa-with-social-entrepreneur_us_585883a0e4b0d5f48e165242|title=Their Generation Speaks: Q&A With Social Entrepreneur, Ohad Elhelo|first=Yuval|last=Rabin|date=19 December 2016|publisher=}}</ref>
The fellowship is fully funded for the fellows.
== History == Our Gеnеrаtіоn Speaks wаѕ fоundеd by Brandeis University student [[Ohad Elhelo]] in 2014. Since its founding, OGS has received financial support and advising from оvеr fіftу independent American, Pаlеѕtіnіаn, and Iѕrаеlі dоnоrѕ whо ѕhаrе its gоаlѕ and vаluеѕ,<ref name=":0" /> including the Kraft Family ([[the Kraft Group]]), former Governor of Massachusetts [[Deval Patrick]], Hаnі Alаmі, a Palestinian telecommunications еntrерrеnеur, and Aron Ain, сhіеf еxесutіvе of [[Kronos Incorporated]]. Former Governor [[Deval Patrick]] ([[Massachusetts]]) currently serves as the Chairman of the OGS Advisory Board, alongside [[Robert Kraft]] who serves as Honorary Chairman.
Our Gеnеrаtіоn Sреаkѕ has since lаunсhеd thrее ѕtаrtuрѕ in Jеruѕаlеm & Rаmаllаh as of September 2016, and expects to launch at least 3 to 4 each year.<ref name=":2" /> Each OGS startup receives seed funding from OGS to establish themselves in Israel and Palestine. Some of the startups have also raised funds independently of OGS.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2016/12/israel-bedouin-genetic-disease-family-doctor.html|title=Bedouin woman battles genetic diseases in Israel's Negev|date=2016-12-30|work=Al-Monitor|access-date=2017-04-13|language=en-us}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/richardbehar/2017/03/21/backed-by-big-wheels-a-boston-incubator-hooks-up-young-israelis-and-palestinians-to-launch-startups/#5655e0d46424|title=Backed By Big Wheels, A Boston Incubator Hooks Up Young Israelis And Palestinians To Launch Startups|last=Behar|first=Richard|work=Forbes|access-date=2017-04-13}}</ref>
In February 2017, three OGS Fellows were featured on [[Forbes]] Israel's "[[Forbes 30 Under 30]]" list for their achievements.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.forbes.co.il/news/new.aspx?Pn6VQ=EG&0r9VQ=EIIJD|title=מפגש תרבויות: שלוש הצעירות שהקימו מיזם לצמצום מחלות גנטיות|website=פורבס ישראל|access-date=2017-04-13}}</ref>
In March 2017, [[Richard Behar]] wrote a feature-length article about OGS for Forbes, featuring OGS Alumni and network members.<ref name=":1" />
In May 2017, OGS was one of two winners of the [https://www.SBANE.org SBANE] Innovation Awards in the Non-profit Category.<ref>{{Citation|last=SBANE.org|title=SBANE Innovation Awards 2017 Winner: Our Generation Speaks|date=2017-05-24|url=https://vimeo.com/218827509|accessdate=2017-08-07}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.sbane.org/blogs/sbane-announces-the-winners-of-the-2017-innovation-awards|title=SBANE Announces the Winners of the 2017 Innovation Awards|last=SemiColonWeb|website=www.sbane.org|language=en-US|access-date=2017-08-07}}</ref>
